refnamediv.refpurpose: Router for the microscopic road traffic simulation SUMO based on junction turning ratios.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: (SUMO-)JTRROUTER computes full vehicle routes (lists of all edges the vehicle has to pass) from flow definitions and turning percentages for junctions.
No dynamic assignment is done herein.

listitem.para: Specifies whether and which a configuration file shall be loaded. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Informs (SUMO-)JTRROUTER to use the sumo-network <SUMO_NET_FILE> for routing. Mandatory, type:filename, default: none

Specifies which edges shall (additionally to edges of the network that are already sinks) be treated as sinks. The list must contain ids of edges the network has, divided by a ';'. Optional, type:list of strings (edge names), default: none
Informs (SUMO-)JTRROUTER to read turn definitions from <filename>. The format (xml or cvs) is determined automatically. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Informs (SUMO-)JTRROUTER to process the file <SUMO_FLOW_DEFINITIONS_FILE> as a flow definition file. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Informs (SUMO-)JTRROUTER to process the files <FILENAME(NO_EXTENSION)>.driver and <FILENAME(NO_EXTENSION)>.rinfo as route definition files. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Builds routes from ARTEMIS-data stored in <ARTEMIS_FOLDER>. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Builds routes from previous sumo-routes. Optional, type:filename, default: none

Informs (SUMO-)JTRROUTER to use the trip definitions stored in <SUMO_TRIP_DEFINITIONS_FILE>. Such trip definitions may be the output of od2trips or made by hand. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Uses route alternatives from <SUMO_ROUTE_ALTERNATIVES_FILE>. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Builds additional random routes. The float to give is the number of routes to build for a simulation second (may be lower than 1). Optional, type:float, default: none

Defines the file to write the computed routes into. Additionally, a second file containing the route alternatives named "<ROUTES_OUTPUT_FILE>.alt" will be generated. Mandatory, type:filename, default: none
The index to each route within the FastLane-rinfo file is saved under cell-route-files-prefix.rindex. Optional, type:bool, default: false (Only for FastLane-processing)
A virtual time to specify the begin of route computation. Previous routes are skipped. Optional (pre-given), type:int, default: 0
A virtual time to specify the end of route computation. Later routes are skipped. Optional (pre-given), type:int, default: 86400
Gawron's beta; See also the documentation on Christian Gawron's Dynamic User Assignment. Optional (pre-given), type:float, default: 0.3 (Only for processing of alternatives)
Gawron's A; See also the documentation on Christian Gawron's Dynamic User Assignment. Optional (pre-given), type:float, default: 0.05 (Only for processing of alternatives)
Switches the byte order within the FastLane-.driver-files. Optional, type:bool, default: false (Only for processing of FastLane-routes)
Use best, not the last cell-route. Optional, type:bool, default: false (Only for processing of FastLane-routes)
Continues when a described connection could not be build. The default behaviour is to stop with an error. Optional, type:bool, default: false

When set to true, all routes are read into the memory before being computed. This is necessary if the routes are in a random order within the files that describe them. Optional, type:bool, default: false

When set to true, all vehicles that shall be emitted on a too short edge are moved one edge further. The default (false) forces the route to discard the route as its not valid (or even quit the computation). Optional, type:bool, default: false
This value describes with which factor the number of edges within the net shall be multiplied to get the maximum number of edges a route may have. Optional (pre-given), type:float, default: 2
Each int timesteps a small message about how many routes were loaded/build/discarded is printed (value must be larger than 0). Optional, type:int, default: always (-1)
Prints some information about the process during execution. Optional, type:bool, default: false
No warnings will be prompted if this option is set. Optional, type:bool, default: false
Prints the current option settings before the execution starts. Optional, type:bool, default: false
All outputs (messages, warnings, and errors) will be written to <LOG_FILE_NAME>. Optional, type:filename, default: none
Initialises the random number generator with the current time (in ms) in the hope to make him generate really random numbers of an unknown order. Optional, type:bool, default: false
Initialises the random number generator with <SEED>. Optional, type:int, default: none

refsect2.title: Examples
refsect2.para: Does the things described by the configuration "myConfig.netc.cfg"

Let one vehicle per second start at a random edge. The vehicle's route ends at a random edge, too. As no begin and no end time was given, random routes (and vehicles) will be generated for a while day.

refsect1.title: CAVEATS
refsect1.para: Being meant as a feature, sumo-routes are not rerouted. The idea was that someone may add some routes that shall not be changed. In fact, we had never to do this and this synopsis is quite confusing.
(SUMO-)JTRROUTER maybe should not do both things, conversion and rerouting.
